result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C. Poler III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Unclassfied Forfeiture. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C. Poler III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:13 PM. Also called 15CF47, 14CF87 and 15CM27. State - 15CF47 - here for INIT and other matters are all resolved. 15CF47 - Burns and Poler have complaint, waives reading of it, set for PH, requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - no objections. Court - bond - modify bond to $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Sheena Tuckwab, sets for PH. State - 15CM27 - plead g/nc to #1 as alleged with court costs only, #2 - amend to city ordinance of obstructing (9.946.41) with a fine of $500 plus costs; 14CF87 - plead G to only count; 13CF181 - #1 - DRI, #2 - plead G as alleged, joint recommendation of 6 years probation with conditions of: 14CF87 - 1 year conditional jail, court costs on each count on each case, same probation conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any taverns or bars, no contact with Mole Lake BP Gas Station, 14CF87 extra conditions include - restitution of $20,882.01 to Sokoagon Chippewa Community - $2,088.20 VW Surcharge totalling $22,970.21 - make payments of no less than $200.00/month commencing first of month after release from incarceration, file State and federal income tax returns each year and provide copy to P&P agent and surrender any possible refunds. Court asks if the defendant is stipulating to the ability to pay the restitution. State has complied with victim notification requirements. Burns and Poler agree. Court - 13CF181 - courts dismisses and reads in count #1, Tuckwab pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court - 15CM27 - Poler pleads G to count #1 as alleged, Court amends count #2 to City of Crandon ordinance of obstructing contrary to 9.946.41, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - paid at rate of $50.00/month commencing one month after release from incarceration or 1 month after obtains employment while incarcerated. Court - 14CF87 - Poler pleads G to only count as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations on all matters. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation on all matters. Poler makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CF87 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 6 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.20, 100 hours of community service on 14CF87 only and to be completed within the first 6 months, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, obtain GED, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, court costs - paid thru probation, restitution total of $22,970.21 with VW surcharge - paid thru probation and paid at no less than $200.00/month commencing on the first day of the month upon release from incarceration, no contact and no entry onto the premises of the Mole Lake BP Gas Station, file State and Federal tax returns each year on or before 4/30/15 and provide a copy to P&P agent and surrender any possible refunds until restitution is paid in full, no contact with Mole Lake BP Gas Station; 15CM27 - court costs only - paid at same rate as count #2 in same case; 13CF181 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 6 years, concurrent to 14CF87, with same conditions except no additional jail time, community service or restitution, court costs - paid thru probation, credit for ? on 14CF87 only if revoked, apply any bond on 14CF87 towards restitution and the bond on 13CF181 - apply to costs, no possession of firearms and voting rights, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Steven C. Poler in court via video from FOSO with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:16 AM. Also called 14CF87 and 13CF181. Burns has complaints but has not gone over the new one with the defendant. Poler does not have copy of 15CM27. Court reads penalties and charges. Burns waives further reading and enters NG pleas on all counts. Bail/Bond Reiview. Burns has same position on bond, defendant will be residing at 913 North Hazeldell Avenue, Crandon, WI 54520. State - no objections but concerns on the living address. Court - reduces each case (14CF87 and 13CF181) to $250.00 cash on each case with same conditions and both those cases also set for FPT on same date and time as 15CM27.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. Refused to sign.
